quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to add a new column entitled ''specialty'' to the table ''students''.
[!raw!]
{0} TABLE students 
{1} specialty varchar(50);
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]ALTER TABLE[/h1]

The [b]ALTER TABLE[/b] command is used to add, delete, or modify columns in an existing table.
You would also use the ALTER TABLE command to add and drop various constraints on an existing table.

Consider the following table called [b]People[/b]: [img id="2852" width="100%"]
The following SQL code adds a new column named [b]DateOfBirth[/b]:[code format="sql"][b]ALTER TABLE[/b] People[b] ADD[/b] DateOfBirth date;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2853" width="100%"]
[note]All rows will have the default value in the newly added column, which, in this case, is NULL.[/note]

quizzes.question: Which choice is the correct command for deleting a table?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Dropping[/h1]

The following SQL code demonstrates how to delete the column named [i]DateOfBirth [/i]in the People table.[code format="sql"][b]ALTER TABLE[/b] People 
[b]DROP COLUMN[/b] DateOfBirth;[/code]
The People table will now look like this: [img id="2852" width="100%"]
[note]The column, along with all of its data, will be completely removed from the table.[/note]
To delete the entire table, use the [b]DROP TABLE[/b] command:[code format="sql"][b]DROP TABLE[/b] People;[/code]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to rename the table ''people'' as ''humans''.
[!raw!]
{0} TABLE people 
{1} {2}
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Renaming[/h1]

The ALTER TABLE command is also used to rename columns: [code format="sql"]ALTER TABLE People
CHANGE FirstName name varchar(100);[/code]
This query will rename the column called FirstName to name.

[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2854" width="100%"]
[h2]Renaming Tables[/h2]

You can rename the entire table using the [b]RENAME [/b]command: [code format="sql"][b]RENAME TABLE[/b] People [b]TO [/b]Users;[/code]
[note]This will rename the table People to Users.[/note]
